column4: hello! im also a newbie, having some trouble with my Ubuntu install. do i need to create a new partition to install it on?
hey, im having some trouble with install. do i need to create a new partition to install 7.04 on?
the installer actually triesto guide you through that. Do you have empty, unpartitioned space on your drive yet?
no, i dont. im going into this fairly blind, so my apologies if i seem a bit daft
so what situation are you in? Running the Live CD on a machine which one big fullsize win-partition on it?
im trying to install to a single win-partition on an older laptop (still a p4 though). i burnt the iso from the site to cd, booted to it and chose the install option
i got an error re: gnome preferences but i let it continue, it eventually just sits on a blank desktop.
so ubuntu is installed, but the install didn't work right, or are you in the process of installing, and it the install hangs?

the install hangs. it ran for about an hour the first  time before i accidently knocked out the power to the laptop(dead/dying battery). i started it again, but still got the gnome preferences error, let it run for about 2 hours when it died
hmmm... so ubiquity (the graphical installer) apparently doesn't work. is this a dual boot machine or will ubuntu be the only OS on it?
single boot
very good. 1.) check if the CD is good, it's got a selftest option at boot. 2.) use the Alternate CD to install.
*if* the installer works on your machine it's best to present an empty unpartitioned disk to him,
thanks :)
gah, smileys
when i selected the cd check option, it flashed up a splash screen which i *think* said 'loading kernel' then hit a black screen and says 'crc error --system halted'
so the CD is a coaster
looks like it
thanks for your help. i'll reburn it and try again. you dont happen to know the iso files md5 sum do you? or have a link to a page that would?
so either your d/l is bad, or your Drive needs cleaning/replacing
the md5 sums matched up...i know thats not definitive, but its usually pretty good isnt it?
thanks, i'll take a look
no luck....thanks anyway for your help; same to jonaskoelker. im gonna give it up for now, hopefully i can get it working soon though.
